params.text:
HARVESTING AND POSTHARVEST HANDLING

          Harvesting of eggplant is either the use of the maturity days from flowering or transplanting or the size of the fruits. Fruits are harvested depending on the consumer’s preference which may dictate the price per kilogram. The marketable are separated from unmarketable fruits and packed in appropriate packaging materials.

Harvesting

           Harvesting starts at 46 to 50 DAT which depends on the variety and intended use of the fruits. Harvest fruits that are shiny and soft. Harvest the fruits twice or thrice a week in the morning by cutting the peduncle with a knife or pruning shears, be sure to leave the calyx (cap end) attached to the fruit. More frequent harvesting can reduce damage from fruit borers. Pre-sort the fruits to remove the unmarketable fruits at field level.

params.text:
POST-HARVEST HANDLING

  • Sorting and packaging.

Sort the fruits according to size and marketability. Pack the marketable fruits in plastic bags (10-kg capacity) with diffusion holes for ventilation. Allot two pricks per kilogram of packed fruits. Put lining materials the package container with sharp edges or sides. Damaged fruits can still be market by converting them into fresh cuts which will be packed in small plastic bags.
